content:
Customize Case Hovers in Lightning Experience

Case hovers give users a sneak peek at the details of a case, including the description and the latest update. They are enabled by default and appear whenever you hover over a case number, except in list views.

To customize compact layouts: Customize Application
To view compact layouts: View Setup and Configuration

Case hovers work in all Lightning apps. To make sure that your users get the most out of case hovers, you can edit the case’s compact layout to customize which fields appear in the hover.

There are three sections in the case hover: title and top fields, description, and the latest update.

To customize the title and fields displayed in the case hover, edit the case’s compact layout. From Setup, select Object Manager, then Case and click Compact Layouts. Create a new compact layout or edit the default layout, add the fields you want to display in the hover, sort them by selecting and clicking Up or Down, save the layout.

You can’t customize the description and latest update sections.

The Latest Update section displays the latest post or activity on the case feed, which is updated whenever you change the sort order in a case feed.
title: Customize Case Hovers in Lightning Experience
